name: Sarah Chen
education: PhD in Electrical Engineering, Stanford University
MS in Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University
BS in Engineering, UC Berkeley
biography: Sarah Chen is a professor in the Department of Computer Science at Northeastern University. Her research focuses on autonomous robotics and deep learning applications. Prior to academia, she worked at Tesla's Autopilot team and NVIDIA Research. She has published extensively in ICRA, IROS, and CVPR conferences.
recent_publications: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Robot Navigation (ICRA 2024)
Vision-Based Obstacle Avoidance in Dynamic Environments (IROS 2023)

name: Michael Rodriguez
education: PhD in Computer Science, MIT
MS in Information Security, Georgia Tech
BS in Computer Engineering, Purdue University
biography: Michael Rodriguez is an associate professor specializing in cybersecurity and distributed systems. Before joining Northeastern, he served as a security consultant for Fortune 500 companies and worked at IBM Research. His work has been featured in top-tier security conferences including USENIX Security and CCS.
recent_publications: Privacy-Preserving Smart Contracts (USENIX Security 2024)
Decentralized Identity Management Systems (CCS 2023)

name: Emily Watson
education: PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, University of Washington
MS in Design, Stanford University
BA in Psychology, Yale University
biography: Emily Watson is an assistant professor focusing on accessible technology design and human-computer interaction. She previously worked at Microsoft Research and Google's Accessibility team. Her research aims to create more inclusive digital experiences for users with disabilities.
recent_publications: Designing Voice Interfaces for Blind Users (CHI 2024)
Accessibility in Virtual Reality Environments (ASSETS 2023)

name: James Kim
education: PhD in Computer Science, UC Berkeley
MS in Database Systems, Stanford University
BS in Mathematics, Seoul National University
biography: James Kim is a professor in database systems and big data analytics. He has extensive industry experience at Oracle, Amazon Web Services, and Samsung Research. His research focuses on scalable data processing systems and has been published in SIGMOD, VLDB, and ICDE.
recent_publications: Optimized Query Processing in Distributed Databases (SIGMOD 2024)
Real-time Graph Analytics at Scale (VLDB 2023)

name: Lisa Thompson
education: PhD in Software Engineering, University of Toronto
MS in Computer Science, University of Waterloo
BS in Software Engineering, McGill University
biography: Lisa Thompson is an associate professor specializing in software engineering and programming languages. She has contributed to open-source projects and worked at Microsoft and JetBrains. Her research focuses on improving developer productivity through better tools and testing methodologies.
recent_publications: Intelligent Code Completion using Deep Learning (ICSE 2024)
Automated Bug Detection in Large Codebases (FSE 2023)

name: Robert Zhang
education: PhD in Theoretical Computer Science, Caltech
MS in Physics, Princeton University
BS in Mathematics and Physics, MIT
biography: Robert Zhang is an assistant professor working on quantum computing and theoretical computer science. He completed postdoctoral research at IBM Quantum and Google Quantum AI. His work bridges quantum physics and computer science, focusing on quantum algorithm development.
recent_publications: Quantum Algorithms for Optimization Problems (Nature Quantum Information 2024)
Error Correction in Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum Devices (Physical Review A 2023)

name: Amanda Foster
education: PhD in Computational Biology, Harvard University
MS in Bioinformatics, University of California San Diego
BS in Biology and Computer Science, Duke University
biography: Amanda Foster is a professor at the intersection of computer science and biology. She has collaborated extensively with pharmaceutical companies and research hospitals. Her computational approaches to drug discovery have been published in Nature, Science, and Bioinformatics journals.
recent_publications: Machine Learning for Protein Folding Prediction (Nature 2024)
Computational Approaches to Cancer Genomics (Science 2023)

name: Daniel Lee
education: PhD in Computer Graphics, University of Southern California
MS in Digital Media, New York University
BA in Art and Computer Science, Brown University
biography: Daniel Lee is an associate professor specializing in computer graphics and virtual reality. He has worked in the entertainment industry at Pixar and Industrial Light & Magic. His research combines artistic creativity with technical innovation in immersive media experiences.
recent_publications: Photorealistic Rendering in Real-time VR (SIGGRAPH 2024)
Haptic Feedback in Virtual Environments (IEEE VR 2023)

name: Jennifer Martinez
education: PhD in Computational Linguistics, University of Edinburgh
MS in Natural Language Processing, Carnegie Mellon University
BA in Linguistics and Computer Science, UCLA
biography: Jennifer Martinez is an assistant professor focusing on natural language processing and computational linguistics. She has worked at Facebook AI Research and Amazon Alexa. Her research addresses challenges in multilingual text processing and cross-linguistic information extraction.
recent_publications: Zero-shot Cross-lingual Named Entity Recognition (ACL 2024)
Multilingual Sentiment Analysis in Social Media (EMNLP 2023)

name: Kevin O'Brien
education: PhD in Computer Networks, University of Cambridge
MS in Electrical Engineering, Trinity College Dublin
BEng in Electronic Engineering, University College Cork
biography: Kevin O'Brien is a professor specializing in computer networks and next-generation communication systems. He has served as a technical advisor for telecom companies and the European Commission. His research contributes to the development of future network architectures and protocols.
recent_publications: Towards 6G: Network Slicing and Edge Intelligence (IEEE Communications Magazine 2024)
Security Challenges in 5G Networks (IEEE Network 2023)

name: Rachel Green
education: PhD in Artificial Intelligence, Oxford University
MSc in Machine Learning, Imperial College London
BSc in Computer Science, University of Manchester
biography: Rachel Green is an associate professor working on artificial intelligence and machine learning systems. She has been involved in AI policy discussions and served on ethics committees for major tech companies. Her research focuses on responsible AI development and multi-agent coordination.
recent_publications: Fairness in Multi-Agent Systems (AAMAS 2024)
Ethical Considerations in Autonomous Decision Making (AI & Society 2023)

name: Thomas Wilson
education: PhD in High-Performance Computing, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
MS in Applied Mathematics, University of Chicago
BS in Computer Science and Mathematics, Rice University
biography: Thomas Wilson is an assistant professor focusing on high-performance computing and parallel algorithms. He has collaborated with national laboratories and supercomputing centers. His work optimizes computational methods for large-scale scientific simulations and data processing.
recent_publications: Scalable Algorithms for Exascale Computing (SC 2024)
GPU-Optimized Sparse Matrix Operations (IPDPS 2023)

name: Maria Gonzalez
education: PhD in Statistics, University of California Berkeley
MS in Data Science, New York University
BS in Mathematics, University of Texas Austin
biography: Maria Gonzalez is a professor in data science and statistical modeling. She has extensive consulting experience with healthcare organizations and financial institutions. Her research develops novel statistical methods for complex data analysis and predictive modeling applications.
recent_publications: Advanced Statistical Methods for Healthcare Data (JASA 2024)
Predictive Modeling in Financial Markets (Journal of Finance 2023)

name: Christopher Davis
education: PhD in Information Systems, London School of Economics
MBA in Technology Management, MIT Sloan
BS in Computer Science, Boston University
biography: Christopher Davis is an associate professor specializing in information systems and digital transformation. He has consulted for major corporations on IT strategy and digital innovation. His research examines how organizations can effectively leverage technology for competitive advantage.
recent_publications: Digital Transformation Success Factors (MIS Quarterly 2024)
Enterprise Architecture in the Cloud Era (JMIS 2023)

name: Nicole Anderson
education: PhD in Mobile Computing, Georgia Institute of Technology
MS in Computer Science, University of Maryland
BS in Electrical Engineering, Virginia Tech
biography: Nicole Anderson is an assistant professor working on mobile and ubiquitous computing systems. She has interned at Apple and Samsung, contributing to mobile platform development. Her research focuses on creating seamless computing experiences across multiple devices and environments.
recent_publications: Energy-Efficient Mobile Edge Computing (MobiCom 2024)
Privacy-Preserving IoT Data Collection (IPSN 2023)

name: Andrew Taylor
education: PhD in Computer Systems, University of Michigan
MS in Computer Science, University of Wisconsin-Madison
BS in Computer Engineering, Iowa State University
biography: Andrew Taylor is a professor specializing in computer systems and operating systems research. He has worked at Intel and AMD on processor architecture. His research focuses on system performance, security, and reliability in modern computing environments.
recent_publications: Security Mechanisms in Modern Operating Systems (SOSP 2024)
Performance Isolation in Containerized Environments (OSDI 2023)

name: Jessica Wang
education: PhD in Computer Vision, University of California San Diego
MS in Electrical Engineering, Stanford University
BS in Applied Mathematics, Peking University
biography: Jessica Wang is an associate professor focusing on computer vision and medical imaging applications. She has collaborated with hospitals and medical device companies to develop diagnostic imaging systems. Her work combines advanced computer vision techniques with clinical applications.
recent_publications: Deep Learning for Medical Image Segmentation (Medical Image Analysis 2024)
Automated Cancer Detection in CT Scans (Nature Medicine 2023)

name: Brian Miller
education: PhD in Computer Science, Harvard University
MS in Economics, London School of Economics
BA in Mathematics and Economics, Williams College
biography: Brian Miller is an assistant professor working at the intersection of computer science and economics. He has consulted for auction houses and financial markets on mechanism design. His research applies game theory and algorithmic thinking to economic and social problems.
recent_publications: Truthful Mechanisms for Online Auctions (EC 2024)
Fair Division with Strategic Agents (WINE 2023)

name: Karen Brown
education: PhD in Educational Technology, Teachers College Columbia University
MEd in Curriculum and Instruction, Harvard Graduate School of Education
BS in Computer Science, Wellesley College
biography: Karen Brown is a professor focusing on educational technology and computer science education. She has developed online learning platforms and worked with edtech startups. Her research examines how technology can improve learning outcomes and accessibility in computer science education.
recent_publications: Personalized Learning in Computer Science Education (Computers & Education 2024)
Gender Gaps in Online Programming Courses (SIGCSE 2023)

name: Steven Clark
education: PhD in Computational Geometry, ETH Zurich
MS in Applied Mathematics, Technical University of Munich
BS in Mathematics, University of Cambridge
biography: Steven Clark is an associate professor specializing in computational geometry and geometric algorithms. He has worked in the CAD industry and collaborated with architecture firms on geometric modeling. His research develops efficient algorithms for processing complex geometric data.
recent_publications: Efficient Algorithms for 3D Mesh Simplification (Computational Geometry 2024)
Geometric Deep Learning for Shape Analysis (SIGGRAPH 2023)

name: Laura Johnson
education: PhD in Digital Humanities, University of Virginia
MA in Media Studies, New York University
BA in English Literature and Computer Science, Swarthmore College
biography: Laura Johnson is an assistant professor working at the intersection of computer science and humanities. She has collaborated with museums and cultural institutions on digital preservation projects. Her research applies computational methods to analyze cultural and social phenomena.
recent_publications: Machine Learning for Historical Text Analysis (Digital Humanities Quarterly 2024)
Social Network Analysis of Literary Communities (ADHO 2023)

name: Mark Roberts
education: PhD in Computer Architecture, University of California Berkeley
MS in Electrical Engineering, MIT
BS in Computer Engineering, University of Texas at Austin
biography: Mark Roberts is a professor specializing in computer architecture and processor design. He has worked at Intel and ARM on processor development. His research focuses on energy-efficient computing architectures and specialized processors for emerging applications.
recent_publications: Low-Power Architectures for Edge AI (ISCA 2024)
Neuromorphic Processor Design Principles (MICRO 2023)

name: Patricia Lewis
education: PhD in Information Visualization, University of Utah
MS in Graphic Design, Rhode Island School of Design
BS in Psychology and Computer Science, Tufts University
biography: Patricia Lewis is an associate professor focusing on information visualization and visual analytics. She has consulted for data analytics companies and government agencies on dashboard design. Her research combines principles from psychology and design to create effective data visualizations.
recent_publications: Cognitive Principles in Data Visualization Design (IEEE TVCG 2024)
Effective Dashboard Design for Decision Making (InfoVis 2023)

name: Ryan Murphy
education: PhD in Privacy and Security, Cornell University
MS in Applied Cryptography, University of Waterloo
BS in Mathematics and Computer Science, McGill University
biography: Ryan Murphy is an assistant professor specializing in privacy-preserving computing and data protection. He has worked with healthcare organizations and financial institutions on implementing privacy technologies. His research develops practical solutions for protecting sensitive data in computational systems.
recent_publications: Differential Privacy in Federated Learning (ICML 2024)
Practical Secure Computation for Healthcare (CCS 2023)

name: Sandra White
education: PhD in Knowledge Representation, University of Edinburgh
MS in Artificial Intelligence, Stanford University
BA in Philosophy and Computer Science, Oxford University
biography: Sandra White is a professor working on knowledge representation and semantic web technologies. She has developed ontologies for major organizations and worked on expert system projects. Her research focuses on representing and reasoning with complex knowledge in AI systems.
recent_publications: Automated Ontology Construction from Text (Semantic Web Journal 2024)
Knowledge Graph Completion Using Symbolic Reasoning (ISWC 2023)

name: Paul Garcia
education: PhD in Formal Methods, Carnegie Mellon University
MS in Software Engineering, University of Texas at Austin
BS in Computer Science, California Institute of Technology
biography: Paul Garcia is an associate professor specializing in formal methods and program verification. He has worked on safety-critical systems for aerospace and automotive industries. His research develops mathematical techniques to ensure software correctness and reliability.
recent_publications: Formal Verification of Autonomous Driving Systems (CAV 2024)
Model Checking for Smart Contract Security (TACAS 2023)

name: Helen Carter
education: PhD in Computational Neuroscience, University of California San Francisco
MS in Biomedical Engineering, Johns Hopkins University
BS in Neuroscience and Computer Science, MIT
biography: Helen Carter is an assistant professor working at the intersection of computer science and neuroscience. She has collaborated with medical centers on brain-computer interface development. Her research applies computational methods to understand brain function and develop neural technologies.
recent_publications: Deep Learning for Neural Signal Decoding (Nature Neuroscience 2024)
Real-time Brain-Computer Interface Control (Journal of Neural Engineering 2023)
